title: Near Louisiana Coast, Storms Leave City With Wrecked Homes, Doubts About the Future
sub_head: Small businesses in Lake Charles must contend with population loss, lack of affordable housing
body:
LAKE CHARLES, La.—Since Codi and Jason Savant bought a children’s gym business two years ago, the city has been hit by two hurricanes, an ice storm and a severe flood—all during the Covid-19 pandemic.
The couple is eking out a small profit with eight employees, falling short of the 10 to 12 workers and early-2021 profitability they had forecast.
